message: Operation 'pushTemplates' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary is somewhat clear but could be more concise and action-oriented. Description is missing entirely, creating significant ambiguity for AI agents. Added details about: (1) the specific action (copies/duplicates templates), (2) required inputs (TemplatesPushModel with source/destination), (3) expected output (confirmation response), (4) side effects (templates duplicated, originals unchanged, potential overwrites), and (5) operational context. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's purpose, prerequisites, and consequences.

data.current_summary: Push templates from one server to another
data.description_suggestion: Copies email templates from a source server to a destination server. Accepts a TemplatesPushModel containing source and destination server identifiers and template selection criteria. Returns a 200 response confirming the push operation completed successfully. Templates are duplicated to the destination server; originals remain unchanged on the source server. Existing templates with the same name on the destination server may be overwritten depending on the operation parameters.
data.reasoning: Summary is somewhat clear but could be more concise and action-oriented. Description is missing entirely, creating significant ambiguity for AI agents. Added details about: (1) the specific action (copies/duplicates templates), (2) required inputs (TemplatesPushModel with source/destination), (3) expected output (confirmation response), (4) side effects (templates duplicated, originals unchanged, potential overwrites), and (5) operational context. This enables AI agents to understand the operation's purpose, prerequisites, and consequences.

message: Operation 'requestReturnPathVerificationForDomain' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Missing description entirely. Added context about what the operation does (initiates verification), what it checks (Return-Path DNS record), prerequisites (valid record must exist), return value (verification status and DNS details), and important side effect (asynchronous nature). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.description_suggestion: Initiates DNS verification for the Return-Path record of the specified domain. This operation triggers a verification request that checks if the Return-Path DNS record is properly configured. The domain must have a valid Return-Path record set up before verification can be requested. Returns the current verification status and any DNS record details. This is an asynchronous operation - verification results may take time to propagate.
data.reasoning: Missing description entirely. Added context about what the operation does (initiates verification), what it checks (Return-Path DNS record), prerequisites (valid record must exist), return value (verification status and DNS details), and important side effect (asynchronous nature). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

Added explanation of what SPF verification does, prerequisites (SPF record must exist), what is returned (verification status and DNS details), and important context about asynchronous nature and DNS propagation delays. data.description_suggestion: Initiates DNS verification for the SPF (Sender Policy Framework) record of the specified domain. This operation triggers a verification check to confirm that the SPF DNS record is properly configured and accessible. The domain must have an SPF record already configured before verification can be requested. Returns the current SPF verification status and DNS record details. This is an asynchronous operation - verification results may take time to propagate across DNS servers.
data.reasoning: Missing description entirely. Added explanation of what SPF verification does, prerequisites (SPF record must exist), what is returned (verification status and DNS details), and important context about asynchronous nature and DNS propagation delays. Helps AI agents understand the operation's purpose and timing expectations.

data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes the specified Sender Signature from the account. The signature is identified by its signatureid parameter. Once deleted, the signature cannot be recovered and cannot be used for sending emails. Returns a confirmation response. This operation may fail if the signature is currently in use by active email sending configurations.

data.description_suggestion: Requests verification of pending DKIM DNS records for a domain. Postmark will check if the DKIM DNS entries have been properly configured and confirmed. Upon successful verification, pending DKIM values will be promoted to active and email signing will begin using the new DKIM key.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear but description is missing. data.description_suggestion: Requests verification of SPF (Sender Policy Framework) DNS records for a sender signature. This operation triggers Postmark to check if the required SPF DNS entry has been properly configured for the sender's domain. Returns the SPF verification result including the required SPF value and current verification status. SPF verification is necessary to authenticate emails sent from this sender signature.

data.summary_suggestion: Delete a server from the account
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a server from the account. This operation removes all server configuration, associated settings, and historical data. Once deleted, the server cannot be recovered. Ensure all necessary data has been backed up before deletion. This action cannot be undone.
